definition[0]: a large piece of metal or leather that soldiers used in the past to protect themselves when fighting
definition[1]: a piece of equipment made of strong plastic, used by the police to protect themselves against angry crowds
definition[2]: something in the shape of a shield, wide at the top and curving to a point at the bottom, that is given as a prize for winning a competition, especially a sports competition
definition[3]: a drawing or model of a shield, wide at the top and curving to a point at the bottom, that is used as a coat of arms
definition[4]: something that protects a person or thing from harm or damage

definition[5]: the small piece of metal that a police officer wears to show that they are a police officer
definition[6]: to protect someone or something from being harmed or damaged
example[1]: Women will often lie to shield even the most abusive partner.
example[2]: He held up his hands, shielding his eyes from the sun.
example[3]: import tariffs that shield firms from foreign competition
explanation[0]: Shield is used mostly in journalism or literature. In everyday English, people usually say protect:
